Description: The conquest of lower Egypt: centre, the allegorical figure of the river Nile, reclining against a sphinx, with its tributary streams represented by children, who clamber over him; in the foreground, one of the children plays with a crocodile, and in the Nile's hand, a sheaf of corn, representive of the fertile agricultural lands which surround the river. (obverse)
Producer name: Die Engraved or Modelled for Reducing Machine: Nicolas Guy Antoine Brenet
Bibliographic references: Hennin 1826 / Histoire Numismatique De La Révolution Française (850, p.594)
Laskey 1818 / Description of a Series of Medals Struck at the National Medal Mint by Order of Napoleon Bonaparte (8)
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Associated events: Commemoration of: Conquest of Lower Egypt (1798)
